creator: ramonchu@teleline.es
text:
Hello. I have succesfully installed Tomcat 3.2.1 on Windows 98, but I have seen 
that the main page of Tomcat says: "This is the default Tomcat home page. This 
page serves as quick reference guide to related resources and is located at:
</path/to/tomcat>/webpages/index.html
But this page is in directory:
</path/to/tomcat>/webapps/ROOT/index.html

And in the README file of Tomcat says that "you can declare a relative or 
absolute directory pathname for de docRoot attribute in the 
TOMCAT_HOME/conf/server.xml file. But I've seen this file and I don't find the 
docRoot attribute.
But I have found a docBase attribute with value  docBase = "webapps/ROOT". 
 
My question is: are the main page of Tomcat and the README file not updated? 
Perhaps in previous Tomcat's versions this index.html file was in a directory 
named "webpages", and perhaps the docRoot attribute was converted to the 
docBase attribute.

I don't think this is a much important bug, but for beginners with Tomcat 
configuration like me is a little confusing.

Thank you very much.
----
Jose Ramon
